data.title: Phase One or Leaf?

Jan 24, 2016

#1

Hello everyone. There really isn't a place for this thread, so here it be. I'm sitting here right now without a functional DSLR. My Canon 7D quit and, frankly, hasn't been as reliable as I'd want. Anyway, since then I've acquired a Mamiya 645AFD and am looking for a digital back for it. I'm torn between a Leaf Aptus (22mp model) or a Phase One P25 (also 22mp).

Phase One Pros:

Integrated Battery, tougher construction, light, excellent image quality

Negatives:

Expensive, TINY screen, can't tether with my non-Firewire laptop

Leaf pros:

Image quality similar to that of the Phase, larger and infinitely better screen, less expensive

Negatives:

Battery hangs below and doesn't look overly stable, open fan port (no shooting in ANY kind of inclement weather-I like shooting in snowstorms), still can't tether, looks a little more fragile than the Phase One.

OK, there it is. If these were your options, which would you choose, and if you can, tell me why? I've been agonizing over this decision for too long now.

OP

OP

I do have a scanner (broken, needs repair, but have an untested one from Goodwill) and I do have a film back, but I need digital for workflow reasons (I promise quick turnaround). Because of my scanning situation, my film work tends not to be as precise. And no, apparently there is no such thing as a true Firewire to USB adapter. So tethering will not be an option unless I somehow win the lottery and come up with the cash to get a Credo or IQ.

OP
